API Reference

Configuration

class bgs.config.BGSConfig(base_url: 'str' = 'https://ogcapi.bgs.ac.uk/collections/world-mineral-statistics/items', statistic_type: 'str' = 'Production', limit: 'int' = 5000, db_path: 'Path' = PosixPath('data/World_Mineral_Archive.db'), table_name: 'str' = 'FullMineralData')[source]

Bases: object

base_url: str = 'https://ogcapi.bgs.ac.uk/collections/world-mineral-statistics/items'
db_path: Path = PosixPath('data/World_Mineral_Archive.db')
limit: int = 5000
statistic_type: str = 'Production'
table_name: str = 'FullMineralData'

Client

bgs.client.fetch_page(base_url: str, *, limit: int, offset: int, statistic_type: str | None = None, timeout: int = 60) → Dict[str, Any][source]
bgs.client.iter_features(base_url: str, *, limit: int, statistic_type: str | None = None, start_offset: int = 0, max_empty_pages: int = 1, sleep_s: float = 0.0)[source]

Database

bgs.db.add_column_if_missing(conn: Connection, table: str, column: str, coltype: str = 'TEXT') → None[source]
bgs.db.connect(db_path: Path) → Connection[source]
bgs.db.count_rows(conn: Connection, table: str) → int[source]
bgs.db.create_index(conn: Connection, *, table: str, index: str, column: str) → None[source]
bgs.db.ensure_table_has_columns(conn: Connection, table: str, columns: Iterable[str], *, default_type: str = 'TEXT') → None[source]

Ensure table has at least the given columns. Adds missing columns as TEXT.

SQLite does not support adding multiple columns at once, so we iterate.

bgs.db.table_exists(conn: Connection, table: str) → bool[source]

Extraction

bgs.extract.build_master_database(*, base_url: str, db_path: Path, table_name: str, statistic_type: str | None = 'Production', limit: int = 5000, start_offset: int = 0, sleep_s: float = 0.0) → Tuple[Path, int][source]

Build or extend a local SQLite archive from the BGS OGC API.

Return type:

(db_path, rows_written)

bgs.extract.is_api_empty_at_offset(*, base_url: str, limit: int, offset: int, statistic_type: str | None = 'Production') → bool[source]

Queries

bgs.queries.get_archive_status(db_path: Path) → DataFrame[source]
bgs.queries.get_table_columns(db_path: Path, table: str) → DataFrame[source]
bgs.queries.run_query(db_path: Path, sql: str) → DataFrame[source]

Reporting
